title: Can football-playing robots beat the World Cup winners by 2050?
description: The robot football league that is hoping to eventually beat the best human team in the world.

title: In rural Afghanistan, a family welcomes Taliban rule
description: The BBC's Jeremy Bowen travels to Helmand province, a month after the hardline Islamists took control.

title: How climate change is making inequality worse, especially for children
description: Children will face up to three times as many extreme climate events as their grandparents, research suggests.

title: Styling a better future for black models at fashion week
description: How one model and one massive fashion show agency are making life a bit more beautiful for black models.

title: Manta rays inspire new device to filter microplastics
description: Wastewater plants release microplastics into the environment, but could manta rays hold the key to a solution?

title: Interviewing the Taliban: 'Still now I am terrified'
description: Afghan news anchor Behishta Arghand made history when she interviewed the Taliban.

title: Labour: 'I joined for Corbyn, but I'm staying'
description: Ana joined the Labour Party in support of Jeremy Corbyn but is staying in the hope of seeing a vision for the future from Keir Starmer.

title: Watch: Tearful McIlroy says he 'should have done more'
description: An emotional Rory McIlroy says he ''should have done more'' for Team Europe after they were beaten by the United States in the Ryder Cup.

title: Who was audacious and who has stage fright? Garth's team of the week
description: Who impressed with their audacity? Who is suffering from acute stage fright? Who can Liverpool depend on in a crisis? Find out in Garth Crooks' team of the week.

title: Labour conference: Any tax rises under Labour will be fair - Starmer
description: The Labour leader says he can't rule out tax rises if Labour wins power, but working families won't be hit.

title: German elections: Voters decide who will take charge after Merkel
description: The election race could barely be tighter as people vote to decide who will run Europe's biggest economy.

title: Labour conference: Angela Rayner stands by calling Boris Johnson 'scum'
description: Labour's deputy leader says she will say sorry when the PM apologises for past "racist" comments.

title: No fuel shortage, says transport secretary
description: Grant Shapps blames "irresponsible" briefing by a haulier group for sparking a rush on petrol stations.

title: TV channels go off air after fire alarm
description: Channel 4 and Channel 5 were among those affected following a fire alarm at a London broadcast centre.

title: The Papers: 'Pay rise for truckers' says PM and Labour 'chaos'
description: Several of Sunday's papers feature developments surrounding the UK's driver shortage.

title: Switzerland same-sex marriage: Voters set to back yes
description: Projections suggest more than 60% have voted yes to the proposal, already law in most of western Europe.

title: Abdirahim Mohamed: Seventh murder charge after teenager stabbed
description: Abdirahim Mohamed, 18, died after being found with multiple stab wounds in Leicester.

title: Covid-19 vaccine passports a 'no brainer', says Nichola Mallon
description: SDLP Infrastructure Minister Nichola Mallon says she has raised the issue with the NI Executive.

title: Amtrak train derails in Montana, killing three and injuring dozens
description: Dozens of people are injured after several carriages of the Amtrak train came off the tracks.

title: Global Citizen Live: Ed Sheeran, Lizzo and Billie Eilish feature in 24-hour concert
description: The Global Citizen Live festival sees performances from more than 60 artists in six continents.

title: Sabina Nessa: Man arrested on suspicion of murder
description: A 38-year-old is arrested early on Sunday in what police describe as a "significant development".

title: 'I'm not a sulker, I will bounce back' - Joshua after shock loss to Usyk
description: Anthony Joshua says he "is not a sulker" and "will bounce back" after his world heavyweight defeat by Oleksandr Usyk.

title: Covid-19: Government approves temporary visas, and stars perform at Global Citizen festival
description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Sunday.

title: US set to regain Ryder Cup after taking 11-5 lead over Europe
description: The United States look set to regain the Ryder Cup after another dominating display on day two at Whistling Straits sees them open a six-point lead over Europe.

title: Bake Off meets Brassed Off - how a community bakery became a showstopper
description: A new stage musical tells the story of how a Liverpool bakery sparked a neighbourhood fightback.

title: London Marathon 2021: Student runs with Essex bone marrow donor 'who saved my life'
description: A student says it will be "so special" to do the London Marathon alongside her bone marrow donor.
